About this event
In America, we don’t put up with would-be kings. NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.

On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.

The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.

On June 14th, we’re showing up everywhere he isn’t—to say no thrones, no crowns, no kings. Check out nokings.org for more information.

A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.

About this event

On June 14, Donald Trump will honor himself with a four-mile military parade in our nation’s capitol. Trump’s tacky parade was inspired by dictators he idolizes, and will cost taxpayers nearly $100 million.

June 14 is our chance to reflect the absurdity of the MAGA regime and the clowns who lead it. To meet this moment, Women’s March will host community circuses nationwide—bold, creative actions that mirror the chaos MAGA has sown across the country. Together, we’ll set a national record for the most circuses held in a single day while we simultaneously refuse to celebrate a petty clown who desperately wants to be seen as strong. We won’t stop until we build the country we all deserve. Our grassroots street circuses turn satire into resistance and reclaim the big tent for democracy.

For this event, we will gather in a private room at Chickie and Pete's Atlantic City, where we can eat, socialize, and hear from special guests. There will be activities for kids like face painting and some supplies to make signs (everyone is welcome to bring their own signs of course!).

From there, we will proceed to the board walk and walk holding our signs!

About this event
We have built a grassroots rainbow coalition for this collective day of action on June 14th. This coalition is a broad spectrum representing the many diverse communities of South Jersey. All who agree with the principles described below are welcome to participate. The following organizations are involved in these efforts:
NAACP Atlantic City https://www.naacpatlanticcity.com
Indivisible Atlantic City: Empathy United https://indivisibleatlanticcity.com
Indivisible Atlantic County https://atlanticcountyindivisible.org
Fight Against Fascism Organization https://www.fightagainstfascism.org
El Pueblo Unido Atlantic City https://www.elpueblounidoac.org
The Atlantic County Queer Alliance (ACQA) https://www.acqanj.com
The Atlantic County Council of Education Associations (ACCEA) https://www.acceanews.org
Women's March Atlantic City
South Jersey Concerned Citizens
Atlantic City Education Association
South Jersey Democratic Women's Forum https://sjdwf.com
We would like to continue to expand this coalition. Please reach out if your organization would like to be a part of this important event.
We will begin our event with a march down the Atlantic City Boardwalk. Starting Point: Missouri Avenue and the Boardwalk at 1:00pm
We will exit the boardwalk at Albany Avenue and march to O'Donnell Park for a rally. Rally Point: O'Donnell Memorial Park 2:00pm
Parking is available on the street and parking garages along the march route.
NO KINGS is a national day of action and mass mobilization in response to increasing authoritarian excesses and corruption from Trump and his allies. We’ve watched as they’ve cracked down on free speech, detained people for their political views, threatened to deport American citizens, and defied the courts. They’ve done this all while continuing to serve and enrich their billionaire allies.
On Saturday, June 14, we’re taking to the streets nationwide. We’re not gathering to feed his ego. We’re building a movement that leaves him behind.
The flag doesn’t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. We’re not watching history happen. We’re making it.
A core principle behind all No Kings events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values.
This march and rally will be completely non-violent. Anyone who violates this principle will be removed.
This event is family friendly. Please avoid any derogatory remarks, chants, or signs that disrespect the humanity of others.

title: Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries
description: Join us to advocate against the elimination of critical funding to libraries, cuts to science grants, and attacks on education. Gather at Sylvester Park and march to the Capitol Building for speeches.
address: Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park
raw_text:
Flame the Enlightenment

CELEBRATION OF SCIENCE, LEARNING, AND LIBRARIES

Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA

July 12, 2025

11AM-3PM

Carl Sagan, the science popularizer wrote in the book, "Demon-Haunted World: Science as a Candle in the Dark," that attacks on science, education and libraries brought about the Dark Ages. Meet at Sylvester Park, then march to the North Steps of the Capital Building for speakers. Protest the elimination of critical funding to the Institute of Library Sciences (IMLS), cuts to critical science grants, and the attacks on higher education, and public instruction. Please contact Wendy at 360-349-2158 or wendy.tassoni@gmail.com.
raw_summary: The image is an event flyer for "Celebration of Science, Learning, and Libraries," scheduled for July 12, 2025, from 11 AM to 3 PM. It will take place at the Legislative Building - North Steps, Sylvester Park, Olympia, WA. The event is about advocating against attacks on science and education. It includes a march and talks to protest against funding cuts to libraries and education sectors.
